responses.content: For the fourth quarter, worldwide net sales were $149.2 billion, representing an increase of 12% year-over-year, excluding approximately 360 basis points of unfavorable impact from changes in foreign exchange rates and above the top end of our Q4 guidance range.

During periods of economic uncertainty, consumers are very careful about how they allocate their resources and where they choose to spend their money. Our focus on the customer helps set us apart in times like these.

responses.topic: Prime Early Access and Holiday Sales
responses.content: We launched our first-ever Prime Early Access sales event in October, along with the traditional Thanksgiving to Cyber Monday holiday weekend. These global sales events outperformed our expectations as customers responded to millions of deals across our growing selection.
Advertising revenues grew 23% year-over-year, excluding the impact of foreign exchange, driven by strong third-party seller and vendor adoption of our advertising solutions.

Prime membership continues to deliver great value to our customers. We invested approximately $7 billion in 2022 across Amazon Originals, live sports, and licensed third-party video content included with Prime, up from about $5 billion in 2021.

AWS net sales increased to $21.4 billion in Q4, up 20% year-over-year, reaching an annualized sales run rate of more than $85 billion. Despite macroeconomic headwinds, AWS continues to grow with a healthy new customer pipeline.

We reported $2.7 billion in operating income for the quarter, negatively impacted by $2.7 billion in one-time charges related to employee severance, impairments, and changes in self-insurance liabilities. Excluding these charges, operating income would have been approximately $5.4 billion.
We made significant progress in streamlining costs within our Amazon stores business, optimizing our labor force, and improving productivity across our fulfillment and transportation networks.
We reported overall net income of $278 million in the fourth quarter, which includes a pretax valuation loss of $2.3 billion from our investment in Rivian Automotive.
Our primary focus is on reducing our cost to serve within our operations network while continuing to invest in long-term strategic areas that enhance customer experiences.

We doubled our fulfillment center footprint and built a transportation network comparable to UPS in a short period. Optimizing and improving efficiency across these expanded networks remains a top priority.
We are continuously improving customer experiences through initiatives like Buy with Prime, RxPass in healthcare, and enhancements in our apparel business to offer a seamless shopping experience.
Grocery remains a significant opportunity for us. We are focusing on omnichannel strategies, integrating online and physical store experiences to better serve our customers.
Our international e-commerce footprint continues to grow robustly. We are investing in both developed and emerging markets, aiming for long-term profitable growth.

We have streamlined our investments to focus on areas with high potential impact, such as streaming entertainment, low Earth orbit satellites with Kuiper, and healthcare, while pausing less critical initiatives.

Prime offers exceptional value through a combination of entertainment, fast shipping, music, gaming, and other benefits. We continue to enhance Prime to drive member engagement and increase wallet share.
